comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Wonderful picture, full of interest, and it reminds me of the Yogi Berra quote, "When you come to a fork in the road, take it." It looks like it was taken from the roof of the Corn Exchange. Reverse view at about the same time - www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2712343375/ . The Boomerang Hotel (with the enormous gas lantern, evidently required by law) was replaced in 1902 by the current Shellbourne Hotel, which narrows the image date to between 1890-1902. I wonder if the photo was part of the plague survey of 1900, or something to do with the planning of street realignment for the new Pyrmont Bridge, opened in 1902?

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: Thanks for adding the PHM photo link, beachcomberaustralia. It really gives this intersection a 3D perspective, doesn't it?. I'm sure you won't be surprised to know this is one of our "Moments in Time" photos on the Archives Outside blog.

comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Sydney's older buildings and structures. , and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The plague albums have many pictures from around this area, and Batson's Lane ( www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/4403061026/ ) is just up Sussex Street, near the sign "J. Ireland 230" . I think this photo is one of the unpublished plague photos which dates it as 1900.

comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: I think this is a beautifully composed photograph.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Eureka! It IS one of the Plague Album 1900-1 photos (John Degotardi jnr, photographer?). In fact the last photo of all, Vol. VI, No.378. Mistakenly labelled as "Corner of Market and Kent Streets" (handwritten in table of contents). Album link at State Library - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/album/albumView.aspx?acmsID=413023&... Image link - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/album/ItemViewer.aspx?itemid=823675&am...

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/lifeasdaddy] Agreed, it is a beautiful photo, much more than a 'snapshot'. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Well done, beachcomberaustralia! ...oddly enough, it is in a different photographic series to that of our own Plague Photos.

comment._content: Untitled, undated photograph in the Art Gallery of NSW collection - www.artgallery.nsw.gov.au/work/419-1985+untitled-sydney-s... - but with reference to this photo, not anymore!
